Transcript: Livvie: Why make things worse? Jamal told you not to come.

Jack: Look, you know that whole Alison thing -- you know, me kissing her was 
a stupid misunderstanding.

Jack: And I'm not going to let it wreck our friendship.

Jack: Livvie, I'm staying, all right? If you want to go home, that's fine.

Jack: Jamal needs my help, all right, even if he's too proud to admit it. Now

Jack: I haven't seen him.

Jack: I don't know. But we've got to find them fast.
Alison: Yeah, I did it, and I'm glad.

Jamal: Glad? Glad? Ali, what are you crazy, throwing away my keys like that,

Alison: Correction. What I am trying to do for you and for myself is

Jamal: I've got to be back at the starting area. Ali, where's my cell phone?
Alison: Right next to mine back at the tent, where I left it.
Jamal: You're proud of yourself, aren't you?

Alison: As a matter of fact, yeah. Look, Jamal, when that guy asked you to

Jamal: Just help me look, Ali.

[Knock on door]
Michael: Eve?
Eve: Michael. Come on in.
Michael: Thank you.

Eve: I was just imagining what life could have been like had things gone 
differently. My husband and I would be rocking our baby to sleep in this 
beautiful cradle that you made. It's lovely.

Michael: I'm glad you like it. I was just wondering if you'd chosen a

Eve: Wow, here's your hat. What's your hurry?
Michael: Oh, I don't mean to rush you.

Eve: Oh, come on. Shame on you, Father Michael. You know the church frowns on

Michael: I know this is a difficult decision for you, so I took the liberty

Eve: The Appalachians. "Bounds Corners." Gee, I like the name of that.

Michael: It's a little village in this little valley. Green hills. Very

Eve: Economically depressed.

Michael: The community's kind of cut off from the rest of the world. There's 
no highway for miles. The people are money poor. But from what I've read, in

Eve: And you think they need me at their clinic?

Michael: Well, they've been praying for a doctor for a long time. The only

Eve: Oh, that's not good, not at all.

Michael: This lady here, Edna Hall. She's the president of the clinic. That's

Eve: Edna Hall. Looks like you've got yourself a doctor. Well, if she gives

Ian: Come on, Eve.
Karen: Frank? No Frank. Nellie.

Frank's Voice: The prince comes across this contraption. Kind of a time 
machine, only it didn't really look like a time machine. More like a piece of 
junk from a long time ago. The prince convinced the queen he came from the 
future. He pleaded with her to help him set things right, put them back on their

prince back to 2001.
Karen's Voice: So did he do it? Did he get her to help him?
Frank's Voice: He told the queen if she did this, she would never be alone.

Rhonda's Voice: He was there. He used to talk to me. He was there when 
Carolyn died. He used to tell me that I had my whole life ahead of me, and, you 
know, when I was feeling sadder than I ever felt in my whole life, he gave me 
hope, and he told me that I wouldn't always feel this alone.

Frank's Voice: It worked. I did it. You're here. You're really here. Oh, I

Karen's Voice: I love you, too.
Frank's Voice: Oh, say it again.
Karen's Voice: I love you, too.
Frank's Voice: You don't know how good it is to hear your voice.
Karen's Voice: Frank?
Frank's Voice: What?
Karen's Voice: You're acting like you haven't seen me in years.
Frank's Voice: If you only knew.

Eve: Ok, so I will let you know as soon as I hear anything from Edna Hall.
Michael: Ok.
Eve: Michael? Thanks again -- for everything.
Michael: You're welcome, Eve.

Jack: Well, I will let you know when I find out. Come on.
Livvie: Oh, no, you don't. No.

Mary: I sure did. Why, I've known her since she was a teenager. Poor darling.

Karen: You know, she mentioned a young man, a stranger in town, that was very

Mary: Yeah. He came here to the house once. We had a nice chat in the

Karen: Did he mention her name?
